column1: 'bony contusion'~'bruise on the bone'~'acute fracture'~'recent break or crack in the bone'~'Medial and lateral joint compartment'~'inner and outer sections of the joint'~'retropatellar joint space'~'the area behind the kneecap'~'articular cartilage'~'smooth, white tissue that covers the ends of bones where they come together to form joints'~'degenerative cyst'~'a fluid-filled sac that forms due to wear and tear'~'quadriceps tendon'~'large tendon (connective tissue) that connects the quadriceps muscle to the kneecap'~'intrameniscal signal'~'internal signals within a knee cartilage (meniscus), often used to detect changes or damage'~'anterior and posterior cruciate ligaments'~'ligaments (connective tissues) located in the front and back of the knee that cross each other to form an "X"'~'lateral and medial collateral ligaments'~'ligaments on the inner (medial) and outer (lateral) sides of your knee'~'intra-articular fluid signal'~'signal coming from the fluid inside a joint'~'suprapatellar bursa'~'fluid-filled sac located above the kneecap that helps reduce friction between the skin and the patella'~'prepatellar bursa'~'fluid-filled sac located in front of the kneecap that helps reduce friction between the skin and the patella'~'chondromalacia patella'~'damage or softening of the cartilage on the underside of the knee cap'~'subchondral cyst formation'~'formation of fluid-filled sacs in the layer of bone just below the cartilage'~'arthroscopic debridement'~'a minimally invasive surgical procedure which involves the removal of damaged tissue through a small incision using a arthroscope'~'physiologic'~'normal body function'.
